page.title: 17OLD FARM HOUSE HORTON.
page.content: My house,built around 1830,is detatched;originally it was brick,but it has recently been rendered white. Until the 1950's it was a farm,owning most of the surrounding land.Now most of it has been sold-but we are left with a two-acre garden. In some ways Old Farm is slighty unusual:for example,most boilers would use oil...ours burns wood.The beams and bricks are far older than the house- three,maybe four hundred years in age. The pantry has become a bathroom,and the three enormous upstairs rooms have each spilt in two. Adventures are often:as the other week,when we took the ancient roof of and it rained...A nest of young blackbirds in the woodshed,or water from a standpipe for nearly a month.And my road is called Old Farm Close!
